alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 7:55AM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Uniontown, Plummer, Oakesdale, Moscow, Colfax, Potlatch, Pullman, Genesee, La Crosse, Tekoa, and Rosalia. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon PST today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute. Winter travel conditions are expected during the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
